description:
Maps are powerful tools that we use every day. Python is well-equipped
to handle spatial data and with well documented robust libraries to help
you perform spatial analysis and create beautiful maps. In this talk,
we'll discover the fascinating world of spatial analysis by solving a
fun problem: where can we go to see an upcoming solar eclipse? Along the
way we'll learn about mapping topics like projections and coordinate
systems, best practices for map making, and intricacies of spatial data.
title: Plan your next eclipse viewing with Jupyter and geopandas
